page.title: 04RIVER CALDEW NEAR DALSTON
page.content:
This section of the{River Caldew}is between Rose Castle and Bridge End. On this stretch there is only one road bridge, which is at Bridge End, and a weir, which is just upstream from the bridge.
On the{River Caldew}is a derelict turbine wheelhouse which used to be used to make electricity. It is opposite Willowclose Wood and just by Highwath Bridge. This footbridge joins Highwath Wood and Willowclose Wood together. These are the two main woods on this section of the river.
There is one main river which joins the{River Caldew}: Roe Beck, also known as River Roe. This river runs through Gaitsgill on a bend. Gaitsgill Bridge crosses the river there.
